0.title: Prez Kovind condoles demise of Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma
0.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday condoled the death of Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma and said, "[His] recitals would leave connoisseurs of Indian classical music spellbound." President Kovind added, "Sad to learn that his Santoor is now silenced. Condolences to his family." Pandit Shivkumar Sharma passed away due to cardiac arrest at the age of 84 on Tuesday.

1.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest rowdy sheeter, recover 20 kg ganja
1.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday arrested a rowdy sheeter and recovered over 20 kilograms of ganja and a dagger knife from his possession. According to the police, the man had hidden the ganja in a plastic gunny bag, containing 10 wrap packs of ganja. He was involved in 34 criminal cases, including murder, robbery, kidnapping and extortion, police said.

2.title: Didn't attend a wedding in 8yrs of 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii': Sakshi
2.article_body: Actress Sakshi Tanwar has revealed in an interview that she didn't attend any weddings during the eight years of her television show 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii' because she wouldn't get the time. She further said that she's now in a phase where work is only a part of her life so she can be with her daughter and her family.

3.title: JD(U) leader urges Bihar CM to save his family from his wife, Naxal commander
3.article_body: JD(U) leader Awadesh Lal Dev has requested Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to save his and his family members' lives from a Naxal group active in Darbhanga. Awadesh claimed that his wife has links with Naxal commander Manoj Laldev, who is threatening to kill his entire family. "On April 23, Manoj along with 50-60 Naxals arrived at my house," he added.

4.title: I can't open my mouth in front of her: Manoj Pahwa on wife Seema
4.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has revealed that he can't open his mouth in front of his wife actress Seema Pahwa. He added that she is a senior actor and can make him feel grounded in a second. Manoj further said that his family is full of critics and Seema has criticised his "terrible acting", saying that he could've done better.

5.title: 2 use forged tickets to enter Pune Airport to see off classmate
5.article_body: Two college students were booked for entering the Pune International Airport using a forged screenshot of an air ticket to see off a classmate who was leaving for Jaipur. The BCom students were caught by the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) while leaving the airport, officers said. The youths are yet to be arrested, police said.

6.title: We outplayed MI in all 3 departments: Shreyas on KKR's 52-run win
6.article_body: Following KKR's 52-run win over MI in IPL, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said his side outplayed the five-time champions in all three departments. "Let's try to gauge what we did really well...let it get into your mind so that we can keep repeating this thing again and again," he added. Chasing 166, MI were all-out for 113 in 17.3 overs.

7.title: Ran out of money during lockdown, in theatre you earn ₹2,000: Sarika
7.article_body: Actress Sarika said that she ran out of money during the COVID-19 pandemic and added that she returned to acting as working in theatre during her acting break earned her ₹2,000-2,700. Talking about the break, Sarika said, "It was a very conscious decision... I thought it would be for a year but it turned out to be five years."

8.title: There's no cut footage of Cruise in 'Doctor Strange 2': Screenwriter
8.article_body: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' screenwriter Michael Waldron said Tom Cruise was considered to be part of the film, however, it never happened due to Cruise's availability. He stated Cruise was shooting for Mission Impossible 7 and 8. Adding that the fan theories were made up, he said, "I mean there's no cut footage of Tom Cruise!"

9.title: Johnny Depp is possessed by pirate demons: Pastor Bob Larson
9.article_body: Evangelist and self-proclaimed exorcist Pastor Bob Larson has claimed that actor Johnny Depp has been possessed by "pirate demons". He said, "I wonder, did Depp get actual pirate demons from playing his Jack Sparrow role [in 'Pirates of the Caribbean']?" This comes amid Depp's defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard over her op-ed claiming to be a domestic abuse survivor.

10.title: Bombay HC refuses to let teen rape victim abort 29-week pregnancy
10.article_body: Bombay HC has denied permission to a 16-year-old rape survivor to terminate her 29-week pregnancy and has directed the Maharashtra government to pay the survivor an interim compensation of ₹50,000. The HC refused permission as a team of doctors opined that if the pregnancy was terminated at this stage, the baby would be born prematurely and suffer from lifelong morbidities.

11.title: Pune civic body plans to charge vehicles for parking on major roads
11.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation is planning to implement a policy under which vehicles will be charged for parking on major city roads. The parking policy was approved by the standing committee in 2018 but did not have a political consensus, a civic official said. He added that PMC will finalise the strategy after discussing it with the police.

12.title: Rahul Dravid not to attend BJP event in Himachal Pradesh, says 'reports incorrect'
12.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has refuted media reports which claimed that he would be participating in BJP Yuva Morcha's National Working Committee session in Dharamshala. "A section of the media has reported that I will attend a meeting in Himachal Pradesh from May 12-15. I wish to clarify that the said report is incorrect," Dravid told ANI.

13.title: Assam tackling illegal migration strongly, Bengal isn't: Amit Shah
13.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah praised Assam for tackling illegal migration strongly while alleging that Bengal hadn't cooperated with the Centre on the same issue. Reacting to Shah's remarks, TMC called them "baseless", adding that it's Border Security Force's (BSF) duty to curb cross-border infiltration. Bengal government has extended all support to Centre on this issue, a TMC leader said.

14.title: Hyderabad Police stops child marriage, rescues minor girl
14.article_body: The She Team of Rachakonda Police averted a child marriage in the Chikatimamidi area and rescued a minor girl. The police also counselled the elders and briefed them about the demerits of child marriage. Last month, Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh M Bhagwat had said that parents, priests, wedding invitation printers, elders and supporters of child marriage will be held responsible.

15.title: Groom shoots guest after argument over music during wedding in UP
15.article_body: A guest at a wedding was shot dead by the groom following an argument over the playing of songs in UP's Muzaffarnagar, police said on Tuesday. Both the groom and the bride's side clashed during the wedding procession as some of them objected to the playing of songs by the DJ, Additional Superintendent of Police (rural) Atul Srivastava said.

16.title: How can PBKS, who have the 2nd worst NRR, still qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
16.article_body: PBKS are currently placed eighth on IPL 2022 points table with 10 points. PBKS currently have the second-worst net run-rate (NRR) of -0.231. PBKS would need to win their remaining three matches (against RCB, DC and SRH) with huge margins to get to 16 points and better their NRR. They'd also want RR and RCB to lose their remaining matches.

17.title: IAS officer said 'strong winds' led to Bihar bridge collapse, I was amazed: Gadkari
17.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said he was "amazed" when his secretary, an IAS officer, told him that a portion of an under-construction bridge in Bihar had collapsed due to "strong winds". Gadkari added, "I fail to understand how a bridge collapsed due to strong winds." The minister also said, "There must be something wrong with the structure."

18.title: You have many questions: Debina on trolling for holding baby 'carelessly'
18.article_body: Television actress Debina Bonnerjee has responded to social media users who trolled her for holding her baby "carelessly" in a video she shared. The actress wrote on Instagram Stories, "So many questions you have!! Why I hold my baby a certain way...All I say is I am surrounded by...protective hands as you can see who say it's all fine."

19.title: Indonesian President plans to meet Musk over nickel supply
19.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo is planning to meet Tesla CEO Elon Musk during a US visit this week, the country's Coordinating Minister Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan said. He added that Musk's representatives were currently in Indonesia and due to visit the nickel production hub of Morowali. Indonesia wants to enter the global supply chain of the EV industry, Luhut said previously.

20.title: German antitrust body's data curb order 'clearly flawed': Meta
20.article_body: Meta on Tuesday said German antitrust watchdog's order to curb Facebook's data collection is "clearly flawed". The order, passed in 2019, said Facebook had abused its market power by collecting users' data without their consent and ordered it to stop. Meta also criticised the German watchdog for not cooperating with the Irish data protection regulator which supervises Facebook.

21.title: I'll make sure that citizens' complaints are addressed: New BBMP chief
21.article_body: The new Chief Commissioner of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), Tushar Giri Nath, has said that he will make sure that citizens' complaints are addressed. He said that monsoon preparedness, preventing the spread of COVID-19 and enhancement of infrastructure are his top priorities. He added that BESCOM and BWSSB should work in coordination and respond to citizens' woes immediately.

22.title: Canada, US' electric aircraft firms want to manufacture in India: Scindia
22.article_body: Several electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) companies from the US and Canada are interested in setting up units in India, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday. He added that eVTOL aircrafts are currently being used by the defence forces of the two countries. An e-VTOL aircraft uses electric power to hover, take off and land vertically.

23.title: Ranveer's 'Jayeshbhai...' cleared for release, court orders new disclaimers to be added
23.article_body: Delhi High Court has cleared Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' for theatrical release on May 13, asking the producers to add new disclaimers. It was hearing a petition that sought removal of a scene involving pre-natal sex determination test. Earlier, the court had demanded a screening, asking producers to show them the relevant scene or face a stay on the release.

24.title: 60 fishermen escape unhurt as their boats capsize off Odisha coast
24.article_body: A group of 60 fishermen had a narrow escape after their boats capsized off Odisha coast in Ganjam due to high tide in the wake of Cyclone Asani. All the fishermen managed to swim to the shore. In the wake of the cyclone, fishermen were advised not to venture into the sea along and off Odisha coast till May 13.

25.title: AAP govt harmful to Punjab's security: Congress' Jaiveer Shergill
25.article_body: Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill criticised the AAP government in Punjab, calling it "harmful" to the state's security a day after a rocket-propelled grenade hit Punjab Police's intelligence wing headquarters in Mohali. He requested Home Minister Amit Shah to get central agencies to probe the incident. "Attack on Police office in Mohali should serve as an alarm...for administration!" he tweeted.

26.title: Class 12 student in Andhra dies while waiting outside exam centre
26.article_body: A 17-year-old class 12 student, Satish, collapsed and died outside the examination centre in Andhra Pradesh's Guduru on Tuesday. A resident of Kammavaripalli village, Satish has been travelling to the town daily to appear in the annual examinations. He suddenly started sweating and collapsed on ground while waiting outside the centre. Doctors suspect he might have suffered cardiac arrest.

27.title: G7's concern over Hong Kong leader's selection is interference: China
27.article_body: China said on Tuesday that G7 countries' concern over the selection of Hong Kong's new chief executive was interference in China's internal affairs. This comes after G7 nations said that selection criteria for the post underscored worries about fundamental freedoms in Hong Kong. John Lee was elected as Hong Kong's new leader by a largely pro-Beijing committee on Sunday.

28.title: Kannada singer falls into open drain with 'chest-deep water' in B'luru, criticises BBMP
28.article_body: Kannada singer Ajay Warrier has claimed that he sustained several stitches and multiple bruises on his leg after he fell into an open drain in Bengaluru. "The water was up to my chest," he said. While criticising the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, Warrier added, "As a...tax-paying citizen of Bengaluru, I'm here to spread this message as a public safety warning."

29.title: Carlos Alcaraz is undoubtedly the best player in the world: Djokovic
29.article_body: Novak Djokovic said Spain's Carlos Alcaraz has been undoubtedly the world's best player so far this year. "At Roland Garros, he is...one of the...favourites...though he's never reached the second week of a Grand Slam," added Djokovic. Alcaraz recently became the first player to beat both Djokovic and Rafael Nadal in the same clay court tournament, during the Madrid Open.

30.title: Ex-village head held for threatening Dalits from entering his field in UP
30.article_body: A former village head was arrested for allegedly threatening the members of the Dalit community from entering his field in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district. Furious after some Dalit members refused to work in his field, the accused, identified as Rajbir Tyagi, announced that Dalit members would be beaten with shoes 50 times if they tried to enter the field.

31.title: Lack of oxygen likely led to fish deaths at Banganga Tank: BMC
31.article_body: A probe by Mumbai's civic body BMC revealed that a severe oxygen deficiency in the city's historic Banganga Tank could have led to the death of thousands of fish. The report comes 20 days after several fish were found belly up in the tank. The water's colour had turned light green due to the presence of toxic components, it said.

32.title: SC asks Centre if sedition law can be put on hold till review, wants reply tomorrow
32.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday asked Centre to reply by tomorrow on whether the sedition law can be paused while the law is being reviewed. "In order to protect the interest of people who are already booked as well as future cases, Centre to file response on whether those can be kept in abeyance till law is re-examined," the court said.

33.title: Jodie Comer to star in Benedict Cumberbatch-backed apocalyptic thriller
33.article_body: Jodie Comer, who recently won the Leading Actress award at the BAFTA TV Awards, has bagged an apocalyptic thriller, 'The End We Start From'. Mahalia Belo has been roped in to direct the film, while Benedict Cumberbatch is attached to the project as executive producer. It is an adaptation of the 2017 novel of the same name by Megan Hunter.

34.title: Anupam hosts 'Fauda' actor Tsahi Halevi at his acting institute, shares video
34.article_body: Anupam Kher hosted Israeli actor Tsahi Halevi, who starred in the spy series 'Fauda', at his acting institute 'Anupam Kher's Actor Prepares' in Mumbai. Taking to Twitter on Monday, Anupam shared a video in which Tsahi could be seen singing 'Tere Jaisa Yaar' at the diploma ceremony of the institute. "We loved the song! Thank you for...warm visit," Anupam wrote.

35.title: Govt aiming to make India a global drone hub by 2030: Scindia
35.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said the government is aiming to make India a global drone hub by 2030. Addressing the 'Experience Studio on Drones' event organised by NITI Aayog, Scindia said the drone industry has a huge potential and can lead to 10,000 jobs. He added India would need nearly a lakh drone pilots in the coming years.

36.title: Always listen to your wife: Pune Police chief to man planning to relocate
36.article_body: Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta replied to over 35 questions during a question and answer session on Twitter on Monday. When a man from Mumbai asked him whether he should relocate to Bengaluru or Pune, which his wife prefers, Gupta replied, "Both are lovely cities, but the rule book says 'Always listen to your wife!'"

37.title: Manipur Police arrest Mumbai BPO employee for post on tribal chief
37.article_body: A 38-year-old resident of Mumbai's Mira Road, Pau Lian Kap, was arrested by Manipur Police after he posted about the death of tribal chief Raja Goukhothang Guite on social media. Kap was arrested after a complaint by the chairperson of the Raja Goukhothang Guite 150th Death Commemoration Committee, reports say. The complaint said that the post promoted enmity between communities.

38.title: Nitin Gadkari inaugurates pothole repair machine in Delhi
38.article_body: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari on Monday inaugurated a pothole repair machine developed by Central Road Research Institute (CRRI). The unique mobile cold mixer cum paver and patch-fill machine can repair 12-15 medium-sized potholes within one hour, officials said. The machines cost ₹30 lakh per unit compared to imported machines that cost ₹2 crore.

39.title: We need to revitalise world economy in inclusive ways: Raghuram Rajan
39.article_body: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that in order to raise investment and productivity, the need is to revitalise global growth in inclusive ways. In an article published in Financial Times, Rajan said, "The easiest solution economically, and the hardest politically, is to reverse the trend to deglobalisation." Developing countries' public spending has been constrained in the pandemic, he added.

40.title: Calling Marvel films 'lesser art' disrespectful to crew: Elizabeth
40.article_body: Actress Elizabeth Olsen, who portrays Scarlet Witch in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has stated that criticising Marvel films as a "lesser type of art" takes away from "the hundreds of very talented crew people". She further said diminishing them with that kind of criticism takes away from all the people who do award-winning films and also work on these projects.

41.title: BJP, Congress want to 'finish off' JD(S): Former K'taka CM Kumaraswamy
41.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday alleged that both BJP and the Congress are luring his party leaders from old Mysuru region. "Their main agenda is to finish off JD(S) and are competing for it," he said, adding that 'true' JD(S) supporters and workers will not abandon the party. "If this regional party remains...this state has future," Kumaraswamy added.

42.title: MP Navneet Rana harassed because she is a Dalit: Ramdas Athawale
42.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has alleged that MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana are facing injustice because of her being a Dalit. "I have always supported Navneet because a great injustice has been done to her by the Maharashtra government," Athawale said. "Sedition should not be imposed in the name of reading Hanuman Chalisa," he added.

43.title: PM Modi replicating Gujarat model across India: Rahul Gandhi
43.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of replicating Gujarat model across India and said, "As the Prime Minister, Modi is doing in country what he did as the chief minister in Gujarat - creating one India for rich and another for common people." Resources of the country are being given away to...few wealthy people, he added.

44.title: 20 died within 6 days of onset of Char Dham Yatra 2022: U'khand govt
44.article_body: As many as 20 people have died within six days of the onset of Char Dham Yatra, the Uttarakhand Health Department confirmed. Most of these deaths have occurred due to cardiac-related issues and altitude sickness, it said. While 14 passengers died in Yamunotri and Gangotri Dham, five devotees died in Kedarnath and one in Badrinath Dham, as per government record.

45.title: Delhi's Mathura Road to be traffic signal-free, to get 4 U-turn underpasses
45.article_body: In a bid to end traffic jams and make travel between central and south Delhi easier, Delhi's Mathura Road stretch will be made traffic signal-free. Public Works Department will remove all five traffic signals on the stretch. Meanwhile, four U-turn underpasses will be provided for smooth travel. Officials said this will be part of ongoing Pragati Maidan corridor redevelopment project.

46.title: Russia's Rutube remains offline for 2nd day, says, 'Hit with biggest cyberattack'
46.article_body: Russia's video platform Rutube remained offline for a second consecutive day on Tuesday after it was hit by a cyberattack just before it was about to stream the Victory Day parade in Moscow on Monday. "We have, in fact, been hit with the biggest cyberattack in Rutube's history," the platform said in a message on Telegram on Tuesday.

47.title: Permission required to use loudspeakers over next 15 days: Karnataka govt
47.article_body: Following Karnataka CM BS Bommai's meeting with state Home Department officials, the state government announced that permission would be required to use loudspeakers in the state over the next 15 days. According to the state government, those who haven't obtained permission should voluntarily remove the loudspeakers. A committee would be formed to decide on the application for use of loudspeakers.

48.title: When I was small, I would always keep the light on: Rafael Nadal
48.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he would always keep the light on when he was small, adding that he nowadays falls asleep with the television on. "Being alone in the dark is something I don't like. I'm not the most courageous guy in the world outside...the court," Nadal had earlier stated. "I won't go on the motorbike," he had further said.

49.title: Tiger Global hit by $17 bn losses in tech stock sell-off: Report
49.article_body: Tiger Global has faced losses of around $17 billion during this year's technology stock sell-off, the Financial Times reported. The firm has erased around two-thirds of its gains in four months, the report added citing calculations by LCH Investments. The losses are reportedly higher than some of the $4-trillion hedge fund industry's most recent losses.

50.title: Group pelts stones at vehicles on highway in MP; several injured
50.article_body: Several people were injured after a group of unknown people pelted stones at vehicles on a four-lane highway on the outskirts of Madhya Pradesh's Badnawar town, police said on Tuesday. The group did so with the intention of theft, however, the occupants didn't stop their vehicles, Free Press Journal reported. The police arrested two people while the others ran away.

51.title: Indian in Dubai stalks, sends lewd messages to Gurugram woman, held
51.article_body: A 30-year-old UP resident working as a domestic servant in Dubai was arrested for stalking a Gurugram woman and sending her sexually suggestive messages, police said on Monday. "The accused claims he doesn't know the woman and he started sending her obscene messages and videos after she replied to her initial messages," said Arti, SHO Women Police Station, Manesar.

52.title: Mentally challenged man hangs himself after killing wife in Tripura
52.article_body: A mentally challenged man hanged himself after killing his wife in a remote village in Tripura. According to police, the incident occurred on Monday when Somen Nath was having lunch with his father-in-law while his wife was serving the food. Somen then allegedly hit his wife with an iron rod after his father-in-law went in to wash hands, police said.

53.title: Actor-model Jethro Lazenby, son of Australian singer Nick Cave, dies at 31
53.article_body: Australian actor-model Jethro Lazenby has passed away at the age of 31. The news of his demise was shared by his father, singer-songwriter Nick Cave. "We'd be grateful for family privacy at this time," he said in a statement. In 2015, Nick's son Arthur died in an accidental fall from a cliff near Brighton, England, at the age of 15.

54.title: 28.5% adults in India are hypertensive: Nationwide survey
54.article_body: In India, 28.5% of adults are hypertensive, according to a multi-centric national survey conducted by the ICMR - National Centre for Disease Informatics and Research. Among them, 27.9% were aware of their hypertensive status, 14.5% were under treatment and 12.6% had their blood pressure under control, according to the survey.

55.title: Man covers bike's number plate with face mask in Hyderabad; fined
55.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Sunday fined a motorist for covering his bike's number plate with a face mask at Rasoolpura, according to a report. The motorist has also been fined for breaking the bike's front number plate. Sharing the information about this incident on Twitter, Hyderabad City Police warned citizens and said, "You could be the next...Correct your improper plates."

56.title: Sri Lankan Prez extends nationwide curfew till May 11 amid unrest
56.article_body: Amid the unrest over economic crisis, Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Tuesday extended the nationwide curfew till May 11. "I instruct everybody not to use any public roads, railways, public parks, public recreation areas or other public territories or the seashore from 7 pm (local time) on May 9 to 7 am on May 11," a presidential decree said.

57.title: Shimron Hetmyer blessed with first child, RR share video
57.article_body: RR batter Shimron Hetmyer has been blessed with his first child. RR took to Instagram to share a video of Hetmyer holding the newborn in his arms and wrote, "The newest (and the cutest) addition to our #RoyalsFamily. Congratulations, @shetmyer and @tequila_goddess_nu." Hetmyer had gone to Guyana for his child's birth and is expected to join RR squad later.

58.title: We aim to end maths phobia: 22-yr-old 'fastest human calculator' on his startup
58.article_body: Neelakantha Bhanu Prakash, the 22-year-old Indian called the 'world's fastest human calculator' for his mental calculation, founded maths edtech startup Bhanzu in 2020. "We aim to eradicate maths phobia and encourage careers in maths and STEM fields," he said. Bhanzu, which provides experiential maths learning courses online, raised its $2 million seed round led by ﻿Lightspeed in February 2022.

59.title: SBI hikes interest rates on bulk term deposits from today
59.article_body: SBI has increased interest rates on its bulk term deposits of ₹2 crore and above across all its tenors except for the 7-45 days tenor. Effective from May 10, for the 46-179 days tenor, the rate has been increased to 3.50% from 3% and for 180-210 days tenor, the rate has been hiked to 3.50% from 3.10%.

60.title: Helen to make acting comeback after 10 years with Karisma-starrer 'Brown...'
60.article_body: Actress Helen will make her comeback to acting after nearly 10 years, with a drama series titled 'Brown - The First Case' starring Karisma Kapoor. It will be directed by Abhinay Deo who helmed the film 'Delhi Belly'. Helen was last seen in 2012 film 'Heroine' which featured Kareena Kapoor Khan. "I was nervous...[about] how things have changed," said Helen.

61.title: I'm glad I chose such a strong project for my OTT debut: Kangana on Lock Upp
61.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, who hosted the recently concluded reality show 'Lock Upp', has called the show an "absolute game-changer in the OTT reality space". She added she's glad that she chose "such a strong and impactful project" for her OTT debut. "The country loved a bold yet original concept...and I'd an incredible time playing...host in this badass jail," said Kangana.

62.title: There's no fear of world in their game: Gavaskar on IPL debutants GT
62.article_body: Commenting on Gujarat Titans' form in IPL 2022, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the IPL debutants are performing well and winning because "there's no fear of the world in their game". He added, "They are enjoying their game and playing positive cricket." GT are currently placed second on the points table, having won eight out of 11 matches so far.

63.title: Nordic defence will get boost if Finland, Sweden join NATO: Minister
63.article_body: Nordic region's defence capabilities will receive a boost if Finland and Sweden decide to join NATO, Swedish Defence Minister Peter Hultqvist said on Tuesday. The countries' joint membership would allow mutual defence planning within NATO's framework, he added. Hultqvist's comments come after Sweden's ruling party said that it'll announce its stance on the country's potential membership on May 15.

64.title: New York Times drops 'fetus' as Wordle solution amid abortion rights row in US
64.article_body: The New York Times, which owns 'Wordle', on Monday removed the word "fetus" as the game's solution to keep it "distinct from the news". This comes amid a row over the leaked Supreme Court draft opinion which indicated that abortion rights may be restricted in the US. The paper warned that some users may still see the outdated answer.

65.title: New Indian VPN regulations are an assault on privacy: ProtonVPN
65.article_body: VPN service ProtonVPN, operated by a Swiss company, called India's new VPN regulations "an assault on privacy", adding that they "threaten to put citizens under a microscope of surveillance". "We remain committed to our no-logs policy," it added. The new VPN regulations released by CERT-In require VPN service providers to collect and hold user data for five years or longer.

66.title: Jharkhand Mining Secretary appears before ED in money laundering case
66.article_body: Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal on Tuesday appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds, officials said. The ED is expected to record Singhal's statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. It had briefly questioned her during raids that were conducted against her on May 6.

67.title: 'Holy man' whose followers ate his faeces arrested in Thailand; police find 11 dead bodies
67.article_body: Police in northeastern Thailand have arrested a self-proclaimed holy man whose followers ate his faeces and drank his urine as a cure for sickness, officials said on Monday. Officers raided the thatched house of 75-year-old Thawee Nanra on Sunday deep in a jungle in Chaiyaphum province. Police said they found 11 corpses on the premises.

68.title: Bumrah showed us the tough length to bowl on DY Patil pitch: KKR's Cummins
68.article_body: Crediting Jasprit Bumrah for his bowling against KKR in IPL 2022, KKR pacer Pat Cummins(3/22) said the MI pacer showed them the tough length to bowl on DY Patil Stadium pitch on Monday. Bumrah's first five-wicket haul in IPL helped reduce KKR from 136/3 in the 14th over to 165/9 after 20. KKR beat MI by 52 runs.

69.title: Issues like Ayodhya visit taking priority instead of inflation: Pawar
69.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that while issues like Ayodhya visit and reciting prayers are taking priority, the Centre has “failed” in tackling the problems of inflation and unemployment. His statement comes ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s visit to Ayodhya on June 5. Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray will also be visiting Ayodhya on June 10.

70.title: 27-yr-old woman kills self over husband's house not having toilet
70.article_body: A 27-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide following arguments with her husband over his house not having a toilet in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore. The couple reportedly had been in a relationship for two years and got married in April. However, the deceased was apparently living with her mother after realising her husband's house didn't have a toilet.

71.title: Was trying to avoid pothole: Driver as bus crashes into pillar in B'luru
71.article_body: After a bus crashed into a metro pillar in Bengaluru, causing injuries to 29 people, the bus driver told the police that he lost control over the vehicle when he was trying to avoid a pothole, a report stated. However, police reportedly said the accident was caused by overspeeding and rash driving. Four passengers were seriously injured in the accident.

72.title: Molotov cocktails thrown at another anti-abortion office in US
72.article_body: An anti-abortion organisation was reportedly attacked using Molotov cocktails in US' Oregon. The police said that one or more persons tried to break into the building, failing which they hurled two Molotov cocktails at it. Notably, in a similar incident that took place around the same time, an anti-abortion centre was attacked by Molotov cocktails and set ablaze in Wisconsin.

73.title: India this year alone extended support worth $3.5 billion to Sri Lankan people: Govt
73.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Sri Lanka, India's External Affair Ministry said, "In keeping with our Neighbourhood First policy, India has extended this year alone support worth over $3.5 billion to people of Sri Lanka for helping them overcome their current difficulties." "India will always be guided by best interests of Sri Lankan people expressed through democratic processes," it added.

74.title: Maisie Williams & Freddie Highmore to star in comedy film 'Sinner V. Saints'
74.article_body: 'Game of Thrones' star Maisie Williams and 'The Good Doctor' actor Freddie Highmore are set to star in the comedy film 'Sinner v. Saints'. Written by Jill Hoppe, it is based on the real-life story of an eccentric MENSA beauty queen who abducted a Mormon missionary in 1970s, according to The Hollywood Reporter. It will be directed by Tim Kirkby.

75.title: We're running shops in mall he built: Ranveer on SRK's impact on B'wood
75.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh called Shah Rukh Khan a "pioneer" of Indian entertainment and said, "He is king for a reason." "I was joking the other day, in Shah Rukh's presence. I was telling a third person...he has built this mall where we are running our small shops," he added. Ranveer stated he has a "great amount of respect" for him.

76.title: Piyush Goyal calls for decriminalisation of Legal Metrology Act
76.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday called for the decriminalisation of the Legal Metrology Act 2009 which seeks to establish and enforce weights and measures standards in the country. "It’s our collective responsibility to ensure that the consumers do not face injustice while at the same time understanding the responsibility towards businessmen so that they can work peacefully," Goyal said.

77.title: 4 dead, 13 injured in road accident in Rajasthan; CM expresses grief
77.article_body: At least four people died and 13 others were injured as the tractor-trolley in which they were travelling overturned after being hit by a truck in Rajasthan's Kota. According to police, the incident occurred on Tuesday morning when the victims were returning from a wedding in Batawda village. CM Ashok Gehlot expressed his deepest condolences over the incident.

78.title: El Salvador buys $15 million worth of Bitcoin as it briefly drops below $30,000
78.article_body: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele on Tuesday took to Twitter to announce that the country has purchased 500 Bitcoins worth more than $15 million. "El Salvador just bought the dip," Bukele said, adding that the coins were bought at an average price of $30,744. The country's purchase comes after Bitcoin briefly fell below $30,000 for first time since July 2021.

79.title: Ex-Facebook moderator sues Meta over working conditions in Kenya
79.article_body: A former moderator working for Meta has filed a lawsuit against it alleging poor working conditions for contracted content moderators in Kenya. The suit alleges workers moderating Facebook posts have been subjected to unreasonable working conditions including irregular pay and inadequate mental health support. Meta's local outsourcing company Sama has been sued as well.

80.title: Operating rooms major contributor to carbon emissions in health sector: Study
80.article_body: As per study, operating rooms make the biggest contribution to carbon emissions within the health sector. Operating rooms generate 70% of the hospital's waste responsible for greenhouse gas emissions. They generate three to six times as much carbon as the rest of health systems, for example, a robotic-assisted hysterectomy produces carbon equivalent to driving over 3,000 kilometres in a car.

81.title: Adopting child directly from parents is not an offence: K'taka HC
81.article_body: Adopting a child directly from parents, where the kid is not abandoned or surrendered or an orphan, does not constitute an offence, the Karnataka High Court has said. The court said this while quashing proceedings against two couples in the Magistrate court. A couple, who had delivered twin girls in 2018, had given one of the children to another couple.

82.title: It’s PM’s resolve to make India global drone hub leader by 2030: Scindia
82.article_body: It is the resolve of PM Narendra Modi to make India the International Drone Hub leader by 2030, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday. "We have to lead the world in this field. Our Ministry is working along with NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant," Scindia added. "We are taking this forward on the basis of three wheels," Scindia stated.

83.title: Punjab attack could have been on Shimla Police HQ: Khalistan group warns Himachal CM
83.article_body: After a rocket-propelled grenade was fired at the Intelligence Wing headquarters of Punjab Police in Mohali, Khalistani outfit Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) warned Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur that the attack could have been on Shimla Police headquarters. "Learn from the grenade attack at Mohali. This grenade attack could have been on Shimla headquarters," SFJ chief Gurpatwant Singh Pannun said.

84.title: Stone-pelting reported as communal clash erupts in Gujarat, 7 detained
84.article_body: Seven persons were detained by police after some members of two communities clashed in the Kaalol town of Gujarat's Panchmahal district, a police officer said on Tuesday. The clash took place when two persons dancing in a wedding procession picked up a fight over a minor issue, Panchmahal SP said. Members of both the communities indulged in stone-pelting, police said.

85.title: BJP books Dalit, Adivasi youths who challenge them: Jignesh Mevani
85.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani on Tuesday claimed that if youths from OBC, Dalit or Adivasi communities challenge the BJP or RSS, then they're booked under false cases like him. The BJP should take back all these cases, he said. He also claimed that the BJP refuses to identify Adivasis by their "true identity" and instead calls them "Vanbandhu and Vanvasi".

86.title: Change names of roads linked to Mughal slavery: Delhi BJP chief
86.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Tuesday wrote to the New Delhi Municipal Council, seeking a change in the names of roads that, he said, are a "symbol of Mughal slavery". Last month, Gupta had spoken about the change in names required for 40 villages. "We are getting lots of requests from these villages to change their names," he said.

87.title: 2 new flyover projects at Delhi's Anand Vihar, Punjabi Bagh approved
87.article_body: Delhi government on Tuesday approved two new flyover projects in the east and west Delhi and added that these will be completed in one-and-a-half years. The new flyovers will be built between Anand Vihar and Apsara Border, and the other between Punjabi Bagh and Raja Garden. "These projects are vital for decongesting city traffic," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said.

88.title: Sanjay told Big B 'I'm leaving because of Mukul': Manoj Desai on 'Khuda Gawah'
88.article_body: 'Khuda Gawah' producer Manoj Desai said that Sanjay Dutt had told Amitabh Bachchan that he was leaving the film because of director Mukul Anand. Desai said they had shot seven reels of the film with Sanjay but later actor Nagarjuna was cast for the role. "Mukul Anand...wanted to shoot his...ads free of cost in Nagarjuna's studio...Nagarjuna bagged...role," he added.

89.title: Blue Origin mission to fly first Mexican-origin woman to space
89.article_body: Billionaire Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin has announced that NS-21 mission, the company's fifth human spaceflight, will include the first Mexican-origin woman to visit space. Katya Echazarreta, 26, is an electrical engineer and ex-NASA test lead. Her seat is sponsored by Space for Humanity and she will provide representation for women and minorities interested in STEM fields, Blue Origin said.

90.title: Man rapes 2 minors in Maha on pretext of giving them roles in films
90.article_body: Police have registered a case against a man for allegedly raping two teenage girls in Maharashtra on the pretext of getting them roles in films, an official said on Tuesday. The accused took the girls to a forest and raped them repeatedly over the last year, said an official from the Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police control room.

91.title: Pune residents to launch 'save Taljai hills campaign' on May 15
91.article_body: Fearing depleting biodiversity, residents of Pune are set to launch 'Taljai Bachao Abhiyan' (save Taljai hills campaign) on May 15. Residents were kept aloof from the various developmental works on hill that were recently inaugurated, Indraneel Sadalge, a member of the Taljai Bachao Abhiyan, stated. "The campaign will begin...with a protest. We're also preparing for a legal battle," he added.

92.title: 15-year-old boy drowns in Mumbai's Vihar Lake
92.article_body: A 15-year-old boy drowned in the Vihar Lake in Mumbai's Powai area. The deceased, identified as Gautam Panchal, had gone for a swim on Monday afternoon but failed to estimate the depth of the water in the lake, police said. His body was taken to a hospital as soon as it was recovered where the doctors declared him dead.

93.title: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' was acting masterclass with Ranveer: Shalini
93.article_body: Actress Shalini Pandey, who will make her Bollywood debut with 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar', shared a still from the film on social media, writing that it was like an acting masterclass with Ranveer Singh. The actress called him "a giant of an actor", adding that she calls him Guruji. "I love this picture...it describes our bond, a natural connection...we formed," Shalini wrote.

94.title: There's lot of noise outside but it doesn't affect me: MI pacer Bumrah
94.article_body: MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah said he knows there's a lot of "noise outside" about his form in ongoing IPL but it doesn't affect him. "Because I'm not a person who judges my performance on what others think or what...experts are saying," he added. Bumrah, who took his maiden fifer in IPL on Monday, has taken 10 wickets from 11 matches.

95.title: I left him confused sometimes: Ex-Real Madrid keeper López on Messi
95.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid goalkeeper Diego López said he managed to confuse former Barcelona forward Lionel Messi sometimes. "The best players I have had in front of me over the years are Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi. I was lucky enough to be Cristiano’s partner for two years," added López. López is the first goalkeeper to save two penalties by the Argentine.

96.title: 'Monster quake' occurs on Mars; 'biggest ever on another planet', says NASA
96.article_body: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory has detected a magnitude 5 "monster quake" on Mars, which it said was "the biggest ever detected on another planet". The tremblor occurred on May 4, 2022, which was the 1,222nd Martian day of the mission involving NASA's InSight Mars lander. On Earth, the tremor would have been considered medium-sized, NASA said.

97.title: Ex-CEC Sunil Arora joins agri-tech startup as non-executive chairman
97.article_body: The former Chief Election Commissioner of India Sunil Arora has joined agri-tech startup 'Gram Unnati' as its new non-executive chairman. Founded in 2013 by IIT-Kharagpur graduate Aneesh Jain, Gram Unnati provides advisory services and access to quality inputs at low costs among other things. Prior to this, Arora has also served in the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship.

98.title: Women dance on vulgar songs with goddess', PM's images in background at MP event
98.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government has suspended Mandsaur's chief municipal officer after videos showing women dancing on vulgar songs with a goddess' image in background at an event surfaced on social media. Pictures of PM Narendra Modi and other leaders were also seen on the banner in the background. State minister Hardeep Singh Dang had demanded action against chief municipal officer.

99.title: Sonu Sood asks for 50 liver transplants worth ₹12 crore as fees to promote a hospital
99.article_body: Sonu Sood, speaking to The Man magazine, recalled how he gave the money from his last few endorsements to charity. Citing an example, he said, "A gentleman...from Aster Hospitals connected with me...and said the group would like to collaborate with me...I said that I'll promote the hospitals, but give me 50 liver transplants. That's almost ₹12 crore in value."

100.title: Bumrah shares pic of match ball after posting his best figures in T20 cricket
100.article_body: MI fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took to Instagram to share a picture of the match ball after he recorded his best figures in T20 cricket. Bumrah, who registered figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR on Monday, wrote, "Disappointed with last night's result but a memorable evening nevertheless." It was Bumrah's first-ever five-wicket haul in T20 cricket.

101.title: BJP created 2 Indias, Cong will form next govt in Gujarat: Rahul
101.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused BJP of creating "two Indias" at a rally in Dahod, Gujarat. "One for the rich and one for the poor, resources of the country belonging to poor people are being given to a few rich people," Gandhi said. The 51-year-old politician also claimed that Congress will form the next government in Gujarat.

102.title: Sri Lanka's ex-PM flees to naval base with family amid violent protests: Reports
102.article_body: Sri Lanka's former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and his family members have reportedly taken shelter at a naval base after violent protests erupted all over the country, amid its worst economic crisis. The Rajapaksas are putting up at Trincomalee Naval Base after fleeing their official residence in Colombo, reports said. Videos showed protests underway in front of the naval base.

103.title: Depp, team celebrate as Heard claims he pushed Kate Moss down stairs
103.article_body: A video shows Johnny Depp and his legal team celebrating after his ex-wife Amber Heard testified he pushed supermodel Kate Moss down the stairs. Heard was testifying in the ongoing defamation trial against her and recounted the first incident she hit Depp which involved her sister. Heard had earlier claimed that people told her Depp pushed Kate down the stairs.

104.title: Does he say the same about Rohit: Hayden on Shastri's 'Kohli needs a break' remark
104.article_body: Talking about Ravi Shastri saying that Virat Kohli needs a break amid his bad form, cricketer-turned-commentator Matthew Hayden said, "Does he say the same about Rohit Sharma? I mean these guys are playing cricket all the time." He added, "No player ever believes that they can go to the selector and go, 'Sorry, I need to be out'."

105.title: Sharp fall in tech stocks crazy, feels like dot-com boom: Zerodha CEO
105.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath on Tuesday tweeted, "The sharp fall in the stock prices of high growth tech companies across the globe is getting crazy, feels like the dot-com boom." He added, "India has weathered the storm mostly because not many such companies are listed & many private ones raised a lot of money last year."

106.title: India's 3 most profitable unicorns are entirely owned by promoters: Report
106.article_body: India's three most profitable unicorns have no venture capital or private equity investors and are entirely owned by promoters or promoter groups, Moneycontrol reported. Zoho Corporation, Zerodha and Mu Sigma are the most profitable Indian unicorns, Moneycontrol added. While Zoho and Zerodha are bootstrapped, Mu Sigma was backed by venture capital firms before its founder bought back their shares.

107.title: Have tradition for newlyweds in our football team: Abhishek on Ranbir
107.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, who led the All Stars Football Club against Emirates United in Dubai, said it was a special match for them as it was Ranbir Kapoor's first match after getting married. He revealed they have a tradition for the newlyweds. "They're going to put me in front of...goal...I'm going to kick lots of balls at them," Ranbir responded.

108.title: Chinese cargo spacecraft docks with its 1st space station's module
108.article_body: An unmanned Chinese cargo spacecraft successfully docked with an orbiting space station module on Tuesday, completing the sixth of 11 missions needed to finish building China's first space station by year-end. The spacecraft transported propellants, application experiments samples, some payloads and supplies for three astronauts. Three astronauts will travel to Tianhe in June for a six-month stay.

109.title: Woman stabbed to death by live-in partner after argument in Delhi
109.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death by her live-in partner after an argument in South Delhi's Mehrauli area on Monday. Police have arrested the accused and recovered a knife from his possession. According to the police, the accused said that he had been unemployed for the last one year, due to which they both fought often over expenses.

110.title: Will make sure AFSPA is removed from all areas in Assam: Amit Shah
110.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said efforts would be made to ensure that the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) is withdrawn from the entire Assam. Earlier, AFSPA was lifted from 23 districts entirely and one district partially in the state. "The day is not far when there won't be even one insurgent outfit in Assam," said Shah.

111.title: Nepalese doctor abducted from UP rescued in Bihar after 10 days
111.article_body: A Nepalese doctor, who was abducted from Uttar Pradesh 10 days ago, has been rescued from Bihar's West Champaran district. He was held captive for a ransom of ₹3 lakh. The accused took him to different locations namely Yogapatti near Lauriya, Pathkauli and Malakauli and tortured him, police said, adding that two accused have been arrested.

112.title: 27 flights cancelled at Andhra's Visakhapatnam Airport due to Cyclone Asani
112.article_body: Flight operations at Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam Airport were severely affected as several flights were cancelled due to the severe cyclonic storm Asani in the Bay of Bengal. Airport Director K Srinivasa Rao said IndiGo has cancelled 23 flights, including both arrivals and departures, citing bad weather. "Four AirAsia flights also stand cancelled due to bad weather at Vizag," he added.

113.title: Shanghai sanitises homes of COVID-infected, shuts all subway lines
113.article_body: The Shanghai administration has started a sanitisation drive under which homes of people infected with COVID-19 are being sanitised using disinfectant sprays. On people's concern about damage to clothes and valuable items, a city official said the residents can inform the teams about items that need protection. The last two operational subway lines in the city have also been suspended.

114.title: Wasps foil suicide bid by woman in Kerala's Alappuzha
114.article_body: Wasps spoiled a woman's suicide attempt in Kerala's Alappuzha on Monday. The woman was climbing a mobile tower and threatened to jump if her husband didn't return her baby. While climbing, she disturbed a nest of wasps, who then swarmed around her and stung her. She rapidly climbed down and jumped when she was a few feet off the ground.

115.title: 14 Punjab policemen booked in Rajasthan on kidnapping charges
115.article_body: Rajasthan Police lodged an FIR against 14 Punjab policemen, including a Deputy Superintendent of Police and a Station House Officer, on kidnapping charges. A 21-year-old man from Boondi was abducted by Punjab Police from a hotel in Kota in March, the FIR states. This comes after Delhi Police booked Punjab Police personnel for the kidnapping of BJP's Tajinder Singh Bagga.

116.title: 16-yr-old boy beaten for theft, sets vehicles on fire in Pune; ₹19 lakh-damage caused
116.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was detained by Pune's Yerawada police after he set fire to vehicles at a housing society's parking lot and caused damage worth ₹19 lakh. The teenager was reportedly enraged as the society's residents had thrashed him after he was caught stealing petrol, police said. A police officer said that the act was caught on a CCTV camera.

117.title: Hindu groups protest near Qutub Minar, demand it be renamed Vishnu Stambh
117.article_body: Hindu groups like United Hindu Front (UHF) and Mahakal Manav Sewa held a protest near the Qutub Minar in Delhi on Tuesday, demanding that the minaret be renamed as Vishnu Stambh. The groups also recited Hanuman Chalisa near the Qutub Minar. A heavy police force has been deployed outside Qutub Minar.

118.title: They lost the only match played as a unit: Ajay Jadeja on GT's loss vs MI
118.article_body: Sharing his opinion on GT's loss against MI by five runs, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said, "The fact is that they lost the only match in which they played as a unit." "GT looked solid from the start but the match slipped at the very end," added Ajay. GT's loss against MI was their second consecutive defeat in IPL 2022.

119.title: Our cultural world is poorer: PM on Pandit Shivkumar Sharma's demise
119.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday took to Twitter to condole the demise of Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma. He wrote, "Our cultural world is poorer...He popularised the Santoor at a global level. His music will continue to enthral the coming generations. Condolences to his family and admirers. Om Shanti." Pandit Shivkumar passed away due to cardiac arrest aged 84.

120.title: Pune woman molested, cheated of ₹50,000 by man she met on dating app
120.article_body: A woman in Pune was allegedly molested and defrauded of ₹50,000 by a man she met on a dating application. According to police, the accused first reached out to the woman in March and then harassed her by seeking sexual favours. The man also sought the amount from the woman on the pretext of expenditure for a vacation to Maldives.

121.title: Swiggy temporarily shuts Genie in Bengaluru, Mumbai due to staff shortage
121.article_body: Swiggy has temporarily shut down its pick-and-drop service Genie in major metro cities including Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Mumbai due to a shortage of workforce and inability to keep up with the demand. According to experts, Genie contributed around 5% to Swiggy’s overall business. The service has reportedly been unavailable in the mentioned areas for the past seven days.

122.title: Ranveer's 'Cirkus' to release on Dec 23, will clash with Tiger's 'Ganapath'
122.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty took to Instagram to announce the release date of his forthcoming project 'Cirkus'. The comedy-drama, starring Ranveer Singh, Pooja Hegde and Jacqueline Fernandez among others, will hit the theatres on December 23, 2022. 'Cirkus' will now clash with Tiger Shroff and Kriti Sanon-starrer action film 'Ganapath', which is being directed by Vikas Bahl.

123.title: PM Modi created 2 Indias, one for rich and one for poor: Rahul
123.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said PM Narendra Modi has created two Indias, one for the rich and another for the poor. He added that the country's resources are being given to a few wealthy people. In the BJP model, resources like water and land, which belong to tribals and other poor people, are being given to a few, he said.

124.title: Neighbour sets woman on fire 2 days before her wedding in Gurugram
124.article_body: A 24-year-old woman in Gurugram suffered 40% burn injuries after she was allegedly set on fire by her neighbour on Monday, two days before her wedding, said police. The victim's father said she was sleeping on their house's terrace when the accused poured petrol on her. He has also alleged that the accused used to pass remarks at his daughter.

125.title: Thane police constable rapes woman on pretext of helping her resolve problems
125.article_body: A police constable has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman under the pretext of helping her resolve her problems in Thane. The constable, who was posted at a police station, where the woman had come to lodge a complaint, befriended her. Police claimed the accused allegedly called her to different places and raped her on various occasions.

126.title: Vivek Agnihotri asks Tharoor if his late wife was Kashmiri Hindu, MP replies
126.article_body: After Vivek Agnihotri asked Shashi Tharoor if Sunanda Pushkar was a Kashmiri Hindu over his 'Singapore banned The Kashmir Files' tweet, the MP said dragging his late wife into the matter was unwarranted. Tharoor tweeted, "One thing I know, unlike those attempting to exploit her when she is not around to speak for herself: She believed in reconciliation, not hate."

127.title: 4 warehouse staffers steal 23,000 wheat bags worth ₹2 cr in Punjab
127.article_body: Four employees of a warehouse were booked on Monday for allegedly siphoning off 23,000 wheat bags worth over ₹2 crore in Punjab's Faridkot. The staffers had claimed that wheat bags were gutted during a fire, however, an investigation report stated that the fire was "put on by the employees intentionally for their personal benefit". The fire occurred earlier this month.

128.title: Russia fires barrage of hypersonic missiles at Ukraine's Odesa
128.article_body: The Russian forces reportedly struck Ukraine's Odesa with a barrage of hypersonic missiles. According to the Ukrainian military, the Russians fired seven missiles from the air which hit a shopping centre and a warehouse. It said that one person was killed while five others were injured in the attack. Ukrainian firefighters doused the fire caused by the strikes.

129.title: JSW Group will make a $7 billion bid for Ambuja Cements, ACC: Chairman
129.article_body: JSW Group's Chairman Sajjan Jindal told Financial Times that the steel-to-energy conglomerate will make a $7 billion bid for Holcim's India subsidiaries Ambuja Cements and ACC. JSW will offer $4.5 billion in its own equity and $2.5 billion from undisclosed private equity partners for the bid. It was earlier reported that Adani Group is in talks to acquire Holcim's assets.

130.title: Sharmila Tagore to make acting comeback after 12 years with 'Gulmohar'
130.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore is set to make an acting comeback with a film titled 'Gulmohar'. The actress, who was last seen in the 2010 romantic-comedy 'Break Ke Baad', said, "After a considerable gap, I am very happy to be in the familiar and well-loved ambience of a film set." 'Gulmohar' also stars Manoj Bajpayee and Suraj Sharma.

131.title: Show us sex determination scene or we won't permit it: Delhi HC on 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'
131.article_body: Delhi High Court asked the producers of the upcoming Ranveer Singh starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' to show it a scene in the movie depicting prenatal sex-determination. "We'll have to see or we'll have to stay. Unless we see for ourselves, we'll not permit this," the court said. "Don't trivialise it to show...anybody can walk into...clinic and get it done," it added.

132.title: Office as we know it, is over: Airbnb CEO on letting staff work remotely forever
132.article_body: After Airbnb allowed its employees to work remotely forever, the company's CEO Brian Chesky said, "I think that the office as we know it, is over." He added, "We can't try to hold on to 2019 any more than 1950. We have to move forward." Chesky questioned whether the office would be invented today if it didn't already exist.

133.title: Anupam Kher meets Deepika Padukone at Dubai airport, shares pics
133.article_body: Anupam Kher on Tuesday shared pictures with actress Deepika Padukone on social media after running into her at Dubai airport. He wrote in the caption, "She being a alumni of @actorprepares her success graph makes me doubly happy and proud!" Actor Prepares is Anupam Kher's acting institute which has also trained actors like Hrithik Roshan, Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani.

134.title: Tamil Nadu to probe reason for 3,000 students skipping board exams
134.article_body: The Tamil Nadu School Education Department has ordered a probe to look into the reason for over 3,000 students missing out on this year's state board exams. According to the official figures, 2,265 and 1,238 students were absent for Class 10 and Class 12 board examinations respectively. Notably, this year's dropout rate is higher than previous years, an official said.

135.title: Meta considers reducing money it gives news firms: Report
135.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta is considering reducing what it pays to news organisations as it reevaluates its partnerships formed in the last few years, The Information reported citing sources. The firm has seen a drop in users clicking on links to news articles since former US President Donald Trump left office. Meta earlier said it was slowing the growth of its workforce.

136.title: Musk's $44 bn Twitter deal at risk of being repriced lower, warns short-seller
136.article_body: Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter could get repriced lower if he walked away from the deal, short-seller Hindenburg Research warned on Monday. "Musk holds all the cards here," Hindenburg, which has a short position on Twitter, said. "If Musk's bid for Twitter disappeared tomorrow, Twitter's equity would fall by 50% from current levels," it added.

137.title: Where's edit button?: Musk's mom after mistake in her tweet about Taj Mahal
137.article_body: Maye Musk, the mother of the world's richest man Elon Musk who is buying Twitter, took to Twitter to share a picture from her Taj Mahal visit. "I went to the Taj Mahal in 2007...It is beautiful," she tweeted, however, she later tweeted, "Not 2007, 2012. Where is that edit button?" Earlier, Twitter confirmed it's working on an edit button.

138.title: Important for Umran to stay away from distractions: VVS Laxman
138.article_body: Former India batter VVS Laxman has said that SRH pacer Umran Malik needs to continue maintaining his focus and importantly stay away from distractions. "Soon you realise that you have to control your actions (off the field). There will be so many advisors...but players...very soon cordon all that off and focus on what is to be done," Laxman said.

139.title: Some bats pretend to be bees to scare off predators: Research
139.article_body: While studying how mouse-eared bats deal with other animals, researchers observed they buzzed like hornets or bees, possibly, in an attempt to push back potential predators. When buzzing sounds were played on speakers, bat predators were seen moving away in contrast to speakers that played non-buzzing sounds. This is the first time a mammal was found mimicking an insect.

140.title: Allahabad HC denies bail to 4 accused in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri case
140.article_body: Allahabad High Court on Monday rejected bail pleas of four accused in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri case. "These accused belong to very influential political families...apprehension of the prosecution that they would interfere with the course of justice...cannot be ruled out at this stage," HC said. The court will hear Union Minister Ajay Mishra's son Ashish Mishra's bail plea on May 25.

141.title: FIFA asks Brazil, Argentina to play abandoned WC qualifier again
141.article_body: Argentina and Brazil have been asked by FIFA to replay their 2022 World Cup qualifier, which was abandoned due to the alleged breach of COVID-19 protocols by the Argentinian side in September 2021. Both teams have qualified for the World Cup in Qatar, with Brazil topping the South American zone qualifying standings and Argentina finishing second.

142.title: Lovlina Borgohain starts with a win at the World Boxing Championships
142.article_body: Indian boxer Lovlina Borgohain won her first bout at the 12th IBA Women's World Boxing Championships. The 24-year-old boxer defeated the Chinese Taipei boxer and former world champion, Chen Nien-Chin, by 3-2 in the 70kg category event. Notably, Borgohain will now meet England's Cindy Ngamba in the 'Round of 16' match on Friday.

143.title: AAP govt in Punjab harmful for state's security: Cong's Jaiveer
143.article_body: Following a blast at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali, Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill said the AAP government in Punjab is "harmful" for the state's security. "I urge Union Home Minister Amit Shah to engage central probe agencies in the matter as AAP government is not capable to handle, nor does it have the right intent," Shergill added.

144.title: Mumbai-based Skillmatics raises $16 mn in Series B led by Sofina
144.article_body: Mumbai-based D2C educational games and resource brand Skillmatics has raised $16 million in its latest funding round led by Sofina Ventures. The funding round also saw participation from existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Jalaj Dani Family Office. Founded by Dhvanil Sheth and Devanshi Kejriwal, Skillmatics designs content-led games and play centric learning resources.

145.title: Only way to experience independence is through education: NASA scientist
145.article_body: The only way to experience true independence and empowerment is through education, an Indian-origin Program Scientist at NASA, Dr Hashima Hasan, said. "Get an education, build your confidence and stand on your own feet," she said while addressing the 7th annual Tehrim Dass Memorial Lecture at the Avadh Girls’ Degree College (AGDC) Lucknow.

146.title: Show some sensitivity towards Kashmiri Pandits for Sunanda's sake: Anupam to Tharoor
146.article_body: After Shashi Tharoor tweeted that Singapore has banned 'The Kashmir Files', actor Anupam Kher tweeted, "Dear Shashi Tharoor! Your callousness towards Kashmiri Hindus' genocide is tragic." Kher added, "If nothing else at least for Sunanda's sake who was a Kashmiri herself, you should show some sensitivity towards Kashmiri Pandits and not feel victorious about a country banning The Kashmir Files!"

147.title: Police raid rave party in B'luru, seize drugs worth ₹3 lakh; 33 held
147.article_body: Bengaluru Police raided a rave party at Otto's gastropub on the Old Airport Road and detained 33 people, including two organisers for allegedly selling and consuming drugs on Sunday. They seized multiple drugs, including MDMA, ecstasy pills, charas and ganja worth around ₹3 lakh from the venue. The attendees reportedly included students, IT firm employees and businessmen among others.

148.title: School athletes mistakenly given sanitiser to drink during race in Japan
148.article_body: Authorities of a Japanese school mistakenly gave sanitisers in cups instead of water to athletes during a race. They accidentally used the sanitiser that was stored in an unlabelled plastic bottle next to drinking water. While one athlete collapsed, vomited and dropped out of the race, a total of three of them were taken to the hospital.

149.title: I was dropped for a couple of games, it's been a tough period: Venkatesh
149.article_body: KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said it has been a tough period for him having been dropped for a few games by the franchise. Venkatesh recently made a comeback in his team's win against MI by 52 runs. "I cannot control what happens out there...I can only control my process and that is what I have been doing," added Venkatesh.

150.title: Bulldozer used to help conduct raid, arrest rape accused: UP to SC
150.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has submitted an affidavit to Supreme Court stating that a bulldozer was used to "help" conduct a raid on the house of two people accused of rape in Saharanpur and make arrests. The affidavit was in response to a petition over unlawful use of bulldozers on suspicion of crime. "Whatever action was taken...was necessary," the affidavit stated.

151.title: Deepika doesn't want same unpleasant path for me: Ranveer on work-life balance
151.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said his wife and actress Deepika Padukone shares the importance of a work-life balance with him, having realised the same herself. "Deepika...guides me because she has also been there. She doesn't want me to go down that same not so pleasant path," added Ranveer. "Deepika's the reason I am able to have this personal evolution," stated Ranveer.

152.title: Mizoram CM flags off inter-state 'Unity' bus service to Tripura
152.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga on Monday flagged off an inter-state bus service called 'Unity' from Aizawl to Behliangchhip town in Tripura. The bus would run from Aizawl every Monday and Thursday, and would return from Behliangchhip every Tuesday and Friday. According to officials, efforts are underway to launch transport services between Aizawl and Churachandpur in Manipur and Tahan in Myanmar.

153.title: 9 lakh Afghans lost their jobs since Taliban takeover: US body
153.article_body: At least 9 lakh Afghans lost their jobs since the Taliban came to power in Afghanistan following withdrawal of American forces, said US Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction (SIGAR). Women's participation in the workforce is expected to shrink by 21% by mid-2022, said a report. Notably, the Taliban recently mandated women to cover their bodies completely in public.

154.title: Very receptive and down to earth CM: Sidhu praises CM Bhagwant Mann
154.article_body: Calling his 50-minute meeting with Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann "very positive", Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday praised Mann, saying he is a "very down to earth CM". "I haven't met such a receptive CM. He was ready to listen," Sidhu said. Sidhu had earlier called Mann a "rubber doll", alleging his government was run by Delhi.

155.title: Won't tolerate delay in implementing budget programmes: Karnataka CM
155.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday warned government officials against any delay in budget implementation. "You're under my radar. My government will not tolerate any delay in implementing...budget programmes," Bommai said during a meeting of Chief Executive Officers of Zilla Panchayats. He further urged the officials to restore public faith in the government by implementing welfare schemes.

156.title: She doesn't need dad's approval: Sona on Aamir's daughter being trolled for bikini pics
156.article_body: Referring to Aamir Khan's daughter Ira getting trolled for being in bikini in front of his father on her birthday, singer Sona Mohapatra, who was present at Ira's birthday party, wrote on Instagram, "She's 25...A free thinking adult woman...Is exercising her choices." Sona added, "She doesn’t need her dad’s approval or yours...Buzz off...Shove your politics where the sun don't shine."

157.title: State-wise percentage of women who are able to refuse sex to husbands released by govt
157.article_body: Eighty-two per cent women in India can say no to their husband if they do not want to have sexual intercourse, according to government's National Family Health Survey 5. The percentage in Lakshadweep, Mizoram and Goa stands at 94.2%, 93.3% and 91.9% respectively. The percentage is the lowest in Ladakh at 60.9%, according to the government data.

158.title: Pak TV channels told not to air content against military, judiciary
158.article_body: The Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PEMRA) has warned TV channels to not air content which casts aspersions against the country's military and judiciary. "Airing such content violated PEMRA rules," it said, adding that the channels could face legal action in case of violation. This comes after the Pakistani military warned journalists against dragging it into political issues.

159.title: 10 flights cancelled at Chennai Airport amid rains, winds due to Cyclone Asani
159.article_body: At least 10 flights have been cancelled at Chennai Airport amid heavy rains and gusty winds due to Cyclone Asani. Chennai Airport Authority confirmed flights to Chennai from Hyderabad, Mumbai, Visakhapatnam and Jaipur have been cancelled. Meanwhile, IMD said severe cyclonic storm lay centred 300 km southeast of Kakinada and 330 km south-southeast of Visakhapatnam at 5.30 am on Tuesday.

160.title: BharatPe fires several employees, to claw back ex-founder's restricted shares
160.article_body: BharatPe on Tuesday said it has initiated an action to claw back restricted shares of its former founder following a governance review. Notably, in a statement, it added that a new code of conduct has been implemented in the company. BharatPe said that it has also terminated the services of several employees who were involved with blocked vendors.

161.title: UGC seeks report from Sharda University over exam question on Hindutva & fascism
161.article_body: The University Grants Commission has sought an action taken report from Sharda University, Greater Noida over an "objectionable" question asked by it in a Political Science examination on similarities between Hindutva and fascism. "Needless to say asking students such questions is against the spirit and ethos of our country which is known for its inclusivity and homogeneity," the UGC said.

162.title: Declare India as Hindu Rashtra, ban other religions: TMC’s Yashwant Sinha
162.article_body: TMC leader Yashwant Sinha on Monday said that a simple solution to all our problems today is to declare India as a "Hindu Rashtra" by amending the Constitution and banning all other religions. "Delete non-Hindu history, take revenge for past wrongs against Hindus by Buddhists, Jains, Muslims and Christians," Sinha added.

163.title: Supreme Court stays arrest of Noida CEO Ritu Maheshwari in contempt case
163.article_body: Supreme Court has stayed the arrest of Noida CEO and IAS officer Ritu Maheshwari in a contempt case. This comes after the Allahabad High Court issued a non-bailable warrant against her. The contempt plea was filed by two persons whose land was acquired in 1990 by the New Okhla Industrial Development Authority (NOIDA) but they were not given fair compensation.

164.title: Sony's Q4 operating profit more than doubles to $1.06 billion
164.article_body: Sony has reported that its fourth-quarter operating profit more than doubled to $1.06 billion, helped by strong performance in its gaming and network services business. Sony's profit for the three months to March 31 stood at $510 million a year earlier. For the current year, Sony forecast operating profit to fall to $8.8 billion from $9.2 billion.

165.title: Very tough for DC to make a comeback after their 91-run loss vs CSK: Kaif
165.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said it is "very difficult" for DC to make a comeback following their defeat against CSK by 91 runs. "Self-doubts creep in after such defeats. Fans will be really disappointed as they wouldn't have expected such an effort," added Kaif. "They are depending a lot on David Warner. It's...like when Warner scores, DC wins," stated Kaif.

166.title: Sports facilities, course for para athletes proposed at Mumbai University
166.article_body: Physical Education department of Mumbai University has submitted proposal to have sports facilities and curated course on fitness training for para athletes. Professor Dr Vasanthi Kadhiravan, head of department, said, "Sports...is...important aspect of lives of differently abled people...not only does it help them in keeping illnesses away...it...enhances motivation and sense of accomplishment."

167.title: Johnny Depp to star as French King Louis XV in Maiwenn's next film: Reports
167.article_body: Johnny Depp is set to feature as French King Louis XV in a film which will be directed by French actress-filmmaker Maiwenn, as per reports. Maiwenn, who'll also star in the film, will play a mistress of the king, Jeanne du Barry, who was beheaded during the French Revolution, according to Deadline. It'll reportedly go on floors on July 8.

168.title: Twitter will comply with EU content rules after takeover: Elon Musk
168.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter will comply with European Union’s rules on content once his proposed takeover is completed. Musk met Thierry Breton, the EU’s Internal Market Commissioner on Monday for the same. The EU agreed on the Digital Services Act last month, which was aimed at urging technology platforms to better police their published content.

169.title: Wasn't happy with work I was doing, thought of quitting acting in 2019: Wamiqa
169.article_body: Wamiqa Gabbi, known for her performances in '83' and 'Mai', has said she was not happy with the kind of work she was doing earlier and even thought of quitting acting in 2019. She added that things have changed for her with shows like 'Grahan' and 'Mai'. "I'm glad that I'm working in the industry in this phase," Wamiqa said.

170.title: Look for traces of Lata ji's singing in every singer I introduce: Bhansali
170.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he grew up "hero-worshipping" late singer Lata Mangeshkar, adding he looks for traces of her singing in every singer he introduces while composing music. "When I discover some rare song of hers, I feel...richer than a diamond merchant," Bhansali had earlier stated. Bhansali termed his recent film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' as his most exhausting movie so far.

171.title: UP government to set up office in Mumbai for its own natives
171.article_body: Uttar Pradesh (UP) government is planning to open an office in Maharashtra's Mumbai to connect with its own natives who're living in the latter state, according to a statement. The decision will help make migrants aware of the possible investments in UP, a government spokesperson said. It will also help people return to UP during any crisis, the spokesperson added.

172.title: Actress Demi Moore shares pic with 'hugging saint' Mata Amritanandamayi Devi
172.article_body: Actress Demi Moore took to social media to share a picture with her daughters and Mata Amritanandamayi Devi, who is known as the hugging saint. "Wow...amazing I had a blessing from this lady she came to Dublin in Ireland. She’s amazing," a fan commented. "Mata Amritanandamayi is your spiritual leader?" wrote another user.

173.title: Gujarat govt to provide ₹100 cr aid to onion farmers
173.article_body: Gujarat government will provide financial assistance of ₹100 crore to onion farmers in the state, Agriculture Minister Raghavji Patel said on Monday. "One farmer can get an assistance of a maximum of 25,000 kilograms...it's an assistance of ₹50,000 per farmer," Patel said.
