He had sustained the injury during MI's match against GT on May 6. Suryakumar played 8 matches for MI this season, scoring 303 runs at an average of 43.29, including three half centuries.

350.title: Firecracker explosion triggers fire near BJP leaders at Noida event
350.article_body: A firecracker exploded and triggered a small fire in a tent under which BJP leaders were seated on a stage during an event in Greater Noida, prompting the local police to launch a probe. The police had asked organisers not to burst firecrackers, but they didn't listen to them, said Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police (Greater Noida) Vishal Pandey.

351.title: Adani Airports raises $250 million for airports development
351.article_body: Adani Airports has raised $250 million funding from a consortium of Standard Chartered and Barclays Bank with an option to raise another $200 million. The funds raised will be used to scale up the airports business into "one of the largest airport platforms globally," a spokesperson said. Adani Airports manages airports in Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Lucknow, Mangaluru and Jaipur, among others.

352.title: I'm okay with going to hell: Musk after 'If I die under mysterious circumstances' tweet
352.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "I'm ok with going to hell, if that is indeed my destination, since the vast majority of all humans ever born will be there." Musk's tweet came hours after he tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Musk's tweets sparked speculation about whether he was receiving threats from Russia.

353.title: Japan will cease to exist, Venice dying due to very low birth rates: Musk
353.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk recently tweeted, "At the risk of stating the obvious, unless something changes to cause the birth rate to exceed the death rate, Japan will eventually cease to exist." He added, "This would be a great loss for the world." In another tweet, Musk said, "Venice is slowly dying due to very low birth rates."

354.title: Cong, AAP leaders blocked bulldozers in Shaheen Bagh: Delhi BJP chief
354.article_body: Congress and AAP leaders blocked bulldozers during the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Monday, hindering government action, said Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta. In letters to Delhi Police and South Delhi Municipal Corporation Commissioners, Gupta said, "I request [the Commissioner] to take just action against [Congress and AAP] leaders for obstructing government work."

355.title: Dumper truck crashes into vehicles leading to oil spill in Thane, 1 injured
355.article_body: Two vehicles were hit by a dumper truck carrying debris on Majiwada Bridge in Thane on Monday. The accident led to an oil spill on the stretch. The driver of the dumper truck, who was trapped inside the vehicle, sustained minor injuries to his right leg. As per reports, he was rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment.

356.title: Russians will always remember India's role in defeating Nazis: Russian envoy
356.article_body: On the occasion of the 77th anniversary of the end of World War 2, Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov said, "Russians will always remember with gratitude the Indian contribution to the defeat of Nazi Germany." He added, "In 1941,1942 friendship societies were set up in India in support of USSR...Indian contingents were engaged in providing supplies to Red Army."

357.title: Local BJP leader shot dead over land dispute in Jharkhand
357.article_body: A local BJP leader was shot dead in his sleep in Jharkhand's Lohardaga district on Monday over a land dispute, police said. The deceased has been identified as Ratan Mahato, a BJP booth committee president. Two alleged assailants have been identified and a manhunt has been launched to arrest them, said officer-in-charge Anil Kumar.

358.title: Babar Azam is the best batter in world at the moment: Vettori
358.article_body: On being asked who is the best batter in the world right now, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "Babar Azam is the most in-form batter on the back of his series against Australia." Babar was the second highest run-getter in Australia-Pakistan ODI series behind Imam-ul-Haq. The Pakistan captain is currently ranked number one in ICC ODI and T20I rankings.

359.title: Kejriwal to visit poll-bound Guj on May 11, will hold rally in Rajkot
359.article_body: AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal will visit poll-bound Gujarat on May 11 and address a rally in Rajkot on same day, party said. This will be Kejriwal's second visit to Gujarat in two weeks as he held rally with a Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP) leader in Bharuch on May 1. AAP will contest Gujarat Assembly polls in alliance with BTP.

360.title: Sri Lankan ruling party MP found dead amid clashes: Police
360.article_body: A lawmaker from Sri Lanka's ruling party was found dead on Monday following a clash with anti-government protesters outside the capital Colombo, the police said. Amarakeerthi Athukorala opened fire and critically wounded two people blocking his car in Nittambuwa, they added. Athukorala was found dead after trying to take refuge in a nearby building, they further said.

361.title: Kids don't care: Kunal on Taimur being trolled for refusing pics
361.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu has reacted to Saif Ali Khan's son Taimur being trolled for asking journalists to stop clicking his pictures, saying, "Kids don't care...they don't have to be diplomatic." Kunal further said, "But I think it's also the people who sit there wanting to comment on this, they need to change." Kunal is Saif's sister Soha Ali Khan's husband.

362.title: Delhi to witness fresh spell of heatwave for next 3 days: IMD
362.article_body: Delhi and its adjoining areas are likely to witness a fresh spell of a heatwave for the next three days, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Monday. The temperature may reach 43°C to 44°C on May 11 and 12. "The April like situation [of heatwave] will not be there in May," said a senior scientist of IMD.

363.title: Over 73% of work on Mumbai Metro Line 3 completed: MMRC
363.article_body: Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation (MMRC) said that over 73% of the work on Line 3 has been completed. Over 82% of the work on stations has also been completed, it added. "The project is running behind the schedule. I have made a catch-up plan to ensure that the project is completed...as per the revised timeline," Metropolitan Commissioner SVR Srinivas said.

364.title: Bulldozers will run at Delhi's New Friends Colony on Tuesday: SDMC
364.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) Central Zone Chairman Rajpal on Monday said illegal encroachments will be removed in New Friends Colony from 11:00 am on Tuesday. "Bulldozers of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi will be running tomorrow as well," Rajpal said. This comes after SDMC's anti-encroachment drive in Shaheen Bagh was halted due to protests on Monday.

365.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband to approach PM against ill-treatment in jail
365.article_body: Maharashtra MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana on Monday said they will approach PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to raise the issue of their alleged ill-treatment by Maharashtra authorities when they were in jail recently. "We had filed a complaint against it here, but no action was taken," Navneet said.

366.title: Will file FIR against ‘popat’ Raut who said he'll bury me: Rana
366.article_body: Amravati MP Navneet Rana on Monday called Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut a 'popat' and said that she will file an FIR against him for threatening to bury her 20-feet deep. Navneet Rana on Sunday challenged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to contest an election against her, adding that Lord Ram will teach Shiv Sena a lesson in civic polls.

367.title: Sky turns blood-red due to rare light phenomenon in China, pics surface
367.article_body: Pictures and videos from a Chinese city showed the sky taking on a blood-red hue due to a rare phenomenon. The sky in Zhoushan turned red on Saturday (May 7) causing panic, after which meteorological experts issued an explanation. The refraction and scattering of light from fishing boats due to more water in the atmosphere led to the colour change.

368.title: 'Prithviraj' educational film, should be shown in schools: Akshay
368.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking at the trailer launch of 'Prithviraj' on Monday, called it an educational film, adding that there's only a paragraph about the warrior in history books. The actor further requested the government to screen the film in schools as a mandatory event so children are told about Indian history. "I want every child to watch it," Akshay added.

369.title: U'khand CM Dhami files nomination papers for Champawat bypoll
369.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami filed his nomination papers on Monday for the upcoming Assembly bypoll for Champawat constituency. Dhami will face Congress leader Nirmala Gahtori in bypoll that is slated to be held on May 31. Ex-BJP MLA Kailash Chandra Gahtori vacated the seat for Dhami after latter lost to Congress' Bhuwan Kapri from Khatima in Uttarakhand Assembly polls.

370.title: Largest passenger elevator, as big as a room, installed at Mumbai's Jio World Centre
370.article_body: KONE Elevator India installed a 25.78 square metre elevator at Mumbai's Jio World Centre and claims that it's the world's largest passenger elevator. The 16-tonne elevator, supported by 18 pulleys and nine ropes for safety, is "as big as a room" and has a four-panel centre opening door and glass walls. It can reportedly carry 200 people at one time.

371.title: Patiala clash main conspirator Barjinder Parwana sent to 14-day judicial custody
371.article_body: The alleged mastermind and main conspirator behind the recent violent clashes in Punjab's Patiala, Barjinder Singh Parwana, has been remanded to a 14-day judicial custody . This comes days after clashes broke out between two groups during an anti-Khalistan protest by Shiv Sena. So far, six people have been arrested in connection with the case.

372.title: Indian women's team beat Canada in their Thomas and Uber Cup opener
372.article_body: Indian women's badminton team beat Canada 4-1 in their opener in Group D at Thomas and Uber Cup Finals in Bangkok on Sunday. Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu gave India 1-0 lead before Canada levelled it 1-1 following Shruti Mishra and Simran Singhi's loss in their doubles match. Later, India won their one doubles and two singles matches.

373.title: Twitter user asks question using 'Munna Bhai...' meme, Pune Police replies
373.article_body: Pune Police chief Amitabh Gupta held a question and answer session on Twitter on Monday. When a person asked him if it was necessary for a traffic police constable to take keys if one mistakenly jumps a signal, he replied, "Is it necessary to break the signal?." The Twitter user had used a meme from the movie 'Munna Bhai MBBS'.

374.title: Ukraine President Zelenskyy's fleece jacket sold for ₹86 lakh in London fundraiser
374.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's fleece jacket, signed by him, was auctioned for £90,000 (₹86,04,680) at a fundraiser for Ukraine in London. According to Ukraine's Embassy to the UK, the goal of the fundraiser, titled 'Brave Ukraine', was to "tell the stories of (Ukraine's) bravery which became iconic during the war, as well as to raise funds to support this bravery."

375.title: You don't need top education to build a company in India: Billionaire Watsa
375.article_body: Canadian billionaire businessman Prem Watsa said he's optimistic about India's startup industry as it's providing opportunity to the "common person". "[India] provides an opportunity...[to] someone who may not have gone to the best schools and universities but has the ability to build a company," Watsa stated. He added, "You got a 100 unicorns...and you'll have a ton more in India."

376.title: We begged them to not beat him up: MP lynching victim's daughter-in-law
376.article_body: Daughter-in-law of Dhansha who was killed on suspicion of cow slaughter a few days ago, said that she saw 20 men beating Dhansha up with sticks and rods. "He was first dragged out of his cot as he was sleeping. When we heard the noise, we came out of the house...We begged them to not beat him up," she added.

377.title: Bihar man gets life imprisonment for abducting, killing 6-yr-old step son
377.article_body: A session's court sentenced rigorous life imprisonment to a man for kidnapping and killing his six-year-old step son in Bihar's Bhabua. The court also imposed a penalty of ₹15,000 and an additional six months imprisonment if the accused failed to deposit the amount. The accused's wife was not staying with him as she was allegedly subjected to domestic violence.

378.title: No problem with action if he's wrong: Rajasthan minister on rape case against son
378.article_body: Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi, whose son Rohit Joshi has been accused of raping a 23-year-old woman over several months, has called for a strict probe into the matter and said he will "always stand with the truth and justice". "If my son has done anything wrong, I would not have any problem if action is taken against him," Mahesh added.

379.title: Over 70 injured after Sri Lankan Prez's supporters clash with protesters
379.article_body: At least 78 people were injured after clashes broke out between Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's supporters and anti-government protesters in Colombo on Monday, AFP reported. Police fired tear gas and water cannons to disperse the crowd, following which, an indefinite nationwide curfew was imposed in the country. Notably, Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has tendered his resignation.

380.title: I hope Man Utd continue to stick with Ronaldo: Beckham
380.article_body: Amid calls for reforms at Manchester United ahead of the next season, former English footballer David Beckham hopes that the five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo remains in the club's plans. "It's important to him...we all know how much United means to him. He's still doing what he does best...so hopefully it continues for another year or two," Beckham said.

381.title: OYO to buy Direct Booker for ₹40 cr to expand footprint in Europe
381.article_body: OYO has agreed to buy Europe-based vacation rental firm Direct Booker for over ₹40 crore with the aim of expanding OYO's footprint in Europe, the company said in a statement. OYO added that it intends to "actively scout" for "tuck-in" acquisitions, especially in the European market. The firm already has nearly 9,000 homes on its Belvilla and Traum Ferienwohnungen platforms.

382.title: 17-year-old boy builds 'mind-controlled' robotic arm in US, pic surfaces
382.article_body: A 17-year-old from Virginia in the US has invented a robotic prosthetic arm that can be controlled by the mind. Benjamin Choi used his sister's 3-D printer and some fishing line to print individual parts of the arm and then bolted them all together. It uses an artificial intelligence (AI) algorithm to interpret the user's brain waves.

383.title: People taunted me for not getting pregnant, tried IVF: Sambhavna
383.article_body: Actress Sambhavna Seth has revealed that she has been taunted and age-shamed for not being able to get pregnant even after many years of marriage. Sambhavna and her husband Avinash Dwivedi got married in 2016. "IVF is one of the ways. Some people might know about it, some might not. We have tried it four times and failed," Sambhavna said.

384.title: 'KGF 2' screened in Seoul; first Kannada film to be showcased in South Korea
384.article_body: Yash starrer-'KGF: Chapter 2' had its screening in Seoul. It was the first Kannada film to be screened in South Korea along with its Hindi version. 'KGF: Chapter 2' was also the first Indian film to be screened post-pandemic. Several fans from India, Nepal, Bangladesh etc. attended the screening in large numbers. The action drama has received tremendous response worldwide.

385.title: 91-run win vs DC gives us lot of confidence: CSK all-rounder Moeen
385.article_body: After CSK's 91-run win over DC in IPL 2022, CSK all-rounder Moeen Ali said winning against a great side boosts the team's confidence going forward. "Any win at the moment is great for us," he added. Moeen posted bowling figures of 4-0-13-3. The defending champions are at the eighth spot on the points table with four wins in 11 matches.

386.title: 65-yr-old ex-Army man held for sexually assaulting 8-yr-old in WB
386.article_body: A 65-year-old ex-Army man was detained by police on Sunday for allegedly sexually assaulting an eight-year-old girl in West Bengal's Siliguri three months ago, an officer said. The matter came to light on Sunday as the girl's family members came to know about the alleged incident from her and a crowd gathered outside the home of the accused.

387.title: Pune Customs arrest woman for smuggling gold worth ₹26 lakh
387.article_body: Pune Customs officers arrested a 34-year-old woman passenger, who had flown in from Dubai for attempting to smuggle 500 grams of gold worth ₹26 lakh. The woman was trying to smuggle the gold in the form of crude bangles and chains, said a senior Customs officer. Police also arrested another woman who had come to receive her at the airport.

388.title: 6-yr-old boy finds megalodon shark tooth while looking for shells on UK beach
388.article_body: A six-year-old boy, Sammy Shelton found a three million-year-old megalodon shark tooth while looking for shells on a beach in the UK. The extinct megalodon was said to be 50 to 60 ft-long, three times the size of great white sharks. His father revealed that Sammy now sleeps with the tooth next to his bed.

389.title: Bus hangs from bridge after collision in Punjab; 2 dead, 17 injured
389.article_body: Two people were killed and about 17 others injured after a Haryana Roadways bus collided with a private bus in Punjab's Mohali, following which the former rammed into the railing and hung from a bridge. One of the deceased fell from the bus after the windshield broke as it hung from the bridge. The Haryana Roadways bus driver was booked.

390.title: Comedy is the nicest genre; it's difficult to make people laugh: Samantha
390.article_body: Actress Samantha Prabhu said that she wants to do more comedy films in the future. "The most difficult thing is to make people laugh. You can make people cry, you can make people sad, but to make people laugh is truly difficult and that is what I love doing," she added. "I feel comedy is the nicest genre," Samantha said.

391.title: I'm fortunate I got to work with Akshay sir: Manushi Chhillar on Prithviraj
391.article_body: When asked how it was working with Akshay Kumar in 'Prithviraj', former Miss World Manushi Chhillar said, "It's my first film so it'll always be special. I'm fortunate that I got to work with Akshay sir." "Yash Raj [Films] has launched me and [Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi] directed my first film. So definitely 'Prithviraj' is very special to me," she added.

392.title: Will always stand with truth: Raj Minister on rape allegations against son
392.article_body: Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi reacted to the allegations of rape against his son, Rohit Joshi, saying that he will always stand with truth and justice. "Police must conduct a strict and in-depth probe…Let the police do their work," Mahesh Joshi said. A 23-year-old woman from Jaipur alleged that Rohit raped her on multiple occasions over a year.

393.title: Actress Mohena Kumari Singh shares first glimpse of her newborn son
393.article_body: Actress-choreographer Mohena Kumari Singh took to Instagram on Sunday to share the first glimpse of her newborn son.  She also penned a poem for her son, which read, "Can't keep my joy at bay. Just happy to be a mum today. Having a celebration with my little one in 2022 on...8th of May and why not...it's my first Mother's Day."

394.title: I finished my work on 'Prithviraj' in just 42 days: Akshay Kumar
394.article_body: Akshay Kumar has revealed that he completed the shooting of his upcoming movie 'Prithviraj' in just 42 days. "Come on time and leave on time, then film completes on time," he added. "It was because of...pandemic that [it] got delayed, otherwise, [it] would've been released long back," said Akshay. 'Prithviraj' also stars Manushi Chhillar, Sonu Sood and Sanjay Dutt.

395.title: I was contemplating retiring out to get Dinesh Karthik in: Faf du Plessis
395.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis has revealed that he was contemplating retiring out against SRH to get Dinesh Karthik in. Talking about Dinesh Karthik scoring 30*(8), Du Plessis said, "If Karthik keeps hitting sixes like that, everyone always wants to get him in and bat for as long as possible...He’s just so clear."

396.title: Uber will treat hiring as a 'privilege' to cut costs: CEO
396.article_body: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi told employees in an e-mail that the company needs to cut costs, citing "the market is experiencing a seismic shift", CNBC reported. "We'll treat hiring as a privilege and be deliberate about when and where we add headcount," the CEO said. "We have to make sure our unit economics work before we go big," he added.

397.title: Pitch didn't suit pace bowling: Josh Hazlewood after win over SRH
397.article_body: After defeating SRH by 67 runs, RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood has said that the Wankhede Stadium's pitch didn't suit pace bowling. "The wicket probably got drier as the match went on. Being a day game, it deteriorated and we took the pace off. Our spinners bowled really well...Tonight's wicket didn't suit pace (bowling)," Hazlewood said.

398.title: Sometimes a break from the game is all you need: Vaughan on Kohli
398.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's form in the ongoing IPL season, former England captain Michael Vaughan said, "Sometimes a break from the game is all a player needs." He added, "The amount of cricket these players play, a break is as good as anything." Kohli has registered three golden ducks and has scored 216 runs in 12 games so far.

399.title: Instagram to support NFTs from Ethereum, Polygon, Solana: Report
399.article_body: Instagram is set to allow users to post and share their non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the platform, CoinDesk reported. As per the report, Instagram is planning NFT integration with Ethereum, Polygon, Solana and Flow, which are the networks that host the majority of trading in NFTs. The pilot will reportedly feature a small group of US-based NFT enthusiasts.

400.title: Arjun Kapoor shares before-after pics showing his physical transformation
400.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram to share before-after pictures showing his physical transformation. He wrote, "15 months of being #workinprogress...I'm immensely proud of this journey. Feb 2021 to May 2022...it's been a tough one and I'm only glad that I could stay on track." He added, "I'm loving the state of mind...I'm in for these past 15 months."

401.title: Salman said I wasn't cut for B'wood, told me to try TV: Sidharth
401.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra has revealed that when he first met actor Salman Khan ahead of his debut, the former told him he wasn't cut out for Bollywood and should try his luck in TV. Sidharth made his debut in 2012 with 'Student of the Year'. Sidharth added Salman later said he made the comments to push him to do better.
